post.author: obihb
post.body:
Even since before starting on the Wolfenstein stuff, I started to make this model, a high poly version of it. I got stuck on it and decided to start on the Wolf project. But of course I couldn't just drop it and so after taking some time away from this stuff I finally got it going again and have it working in the game.

Anyway, this is just a little teaser and you can see this guy is just a little camera shy..

Video - 216k

post.author: obihb
post.body:
Thanks, as always I really appreciate the positive comments.

ajm113: The "flying guy" is the Wizard or Scrag from Quake. As you may or may not know these are all old Quake monsters.

ratty redemption: Not really sure what to say about the toes.. hahahaa.. it really wasn't something that came to my attention at all until now. I can see what you mean and maybe I'll come up with a reason.. like hhmmm.. I'm too lazy to change hehee.

Tron: Yeah, the fur.. something that I decided against right in the beginning of making the Shambler. I think just about everyone commented on that, but as it stands, the engine can't do decent fur to my liking, so it's just not in there at all. I'm not a fan of the "bump mapped" fur, it looks too much like clay.

As for the fiend, I'm sure they have eyes, or rather what looks like eyes to me anyway. If they didn't.. then.. they do now..

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
obihb, hehe fair enough

I also agree with leaving fur out until the engine can do it convincing enough.

post.author: dsm
post.body:
6th Venom wrote:
Damn! Where are my famous zombies?

Go play the Hell map in Doom 3 - there's a part where it's got a bunch of burnt, skeletal zombies - there's your Quake zombies. That's basically what Quake's zombies look like in a modern 3d engine.



Oooh, a new Scrag (or Wizard)! /Me likes a lot

The Shambler I don't really dig entirely (although it's a great model you've done there). The original had what looked like bloody hoofs, and its muscles weren't as pronounced. I think I read in an interview with John Romero that the Shambler was supposed to have fur or something.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: stunning work obihb, although personally I think the new shambler's toenails look like they are raised up too much from the rest of his toes, ie those bump shadows around his toenails look too strong to me.

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
I can already see a Q1 medieval map into the D3 engine... awesome!
Damn! Where are my famous zombies?

post.author: Tron
post.body: That's really cool apart from the fact the Shambler is meant to be furry and fiends don't have eyes.

post.author: obihb
post.body:
Thanks, as always I really appreciate the positive comments.

ajm113: The "flying guy" is the Wizard or Scrag from Quake. As you may or may not know these are all old Quake monsters.

ratty redemption: Not really sure what to say about the toes.. hahahaa.. it really wasn't something that came to my attention at all until now. I can see what you mean and maybe I'll come up with a reason.. like hhmmm.. I'm too lazy to change hehee.

Tron: Yeah, the fur.. something that I decided against right in the beginning of making the Shambler. I think just about everyone commented on that, but as it stands, the engine can't do decent fur to my liking, so it's just not in there at all. I'm not a fan of the "bump mapped" fur, it looks too much like clay.

As for the fiend, I'm sure they have eyes, or rather what looks like eyes to me anyway. If they didn't.. then.. they do now..

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
obihb, hehe fair enough

I also agree with leaving fur out until the engine can do it convincing enough.

post.author: dsm
post.body:
6th Venom wrote:
Damn! Where are my famous zombies?

Go play the Hell map in Doom 3 - there's a part where it's got a bunch of burnt, skeletal zombies - there's your Quake zombies. That's basically what Quake's zombies look like in a modern 3d engine.



Oooh, a new Scrag (or Wizard)! /Me likes a lot

The Shambler I don't really dig entirely (although it's a great model you've done there). The original had what looked like bloody hoofs, and its muscles weren't as pronounced. I think I read in an interview with John Romero that the Shambler was supposed to have fur or something.

post.author: obihb
post.body:
Even since before starting on the Wolfenstein stuff, I started to make this model, a high poly version of it. I got stuck on it and decided to start on the Wolf project. But of course I couldn't just drop it and so after taking some time away from this stuff I finally got it going again and have it working in the game.

Anyway, this is just a little teaser and you can see this guy is just a little camera shy..

Video - 216k

post.body:
Cool, thanks for all the positive comments.

post.author: whatthe
post.body: That model looks amazing, are you going to release it.

post.author: obihb
post.body:
Thanks..

Yes, the arms clip for 1 frame on each side. This won't happen for any of the final stuff for sure.

whatthe: I am gonna release all the monsters I make yes. This includes a brand new Shambler, much updated model and some updated animation and much more difficult to fight. The Demon, The Wizard and of course this Vore. They will be released with heXum's mod Shambler's Castle.

post.author: obihb
post.body:
Thanks..

Yes, the arms clip for 1 frame on each side. This won't happen for any of the final stuff for sure.

whatthe: I am gonna release all the monsters I make yes. This includes a brand new Shambler, much updated model and some updated animation and much more difficult to fight. The Demon, The Wizard and of course this Vore. They will be released with heXum's mod Shambler's Castle.

I am gonna release all the monsters I make yes. This includes a brand new Shambler, much updated model and some updated animation and much more difficult to fight. The Demon, The Wizard and of course this Vore. They will be released with heXum's mod Shambler's Castle..

http://ug.dyndns.org/~hexum/maps/castle/castle.htm

post.date: Posted: Thu Jan 25, 2007 2:03 pm Post subject:
post.author: obihb
post.body:
Thanks, as always I really appreciate the positive comments.

ajm113: The "flying guy" is the Wizard or Scrag from Quake. As you may or may not know these are all old Quake monsters.

ratty redemption: Not really sure what to say about the toes.. hahahaa.. it really wasn't something that came to my attention at all until now. I can see what you mean and maybe I'll come up with a reason.. like hhmmm.. I'm too lazy to change hehee.

Tron: Yeah, the fur.. something that I decided against right in the beginning of making the Shambler. I think just about everyone commented on that, but as it stands, the engine can't do decent fur to my liking, so it's just not in there at all. I'm not a fan of the "bump mapped" fur, it looks too much like clay.

As for the fiend, I'm sure they have eyes, or rather what looks like eyes to me anyway. If they didn't.. then.. they do now..
_________________
Obi-Wan

post.date: Posted: Fri Jan 26, 2007 7:39 pm Post subject:
post.author: dsm
post.body:
6th Venom wrote:

Damn! Where are my famous zombies?

Go play the Hell map in Doom 3 - there's a part where it's got a bunch of burnt, skeletal zombies - there's your Quake zombies. That's basically what Quake's zombies look like in a modern 3d engine.



Oooh, a new Scrag (or Wizard)! /Me likes a lot

The Shambler I don't really dig entirely (although it's a great model you've done there). The original had what looked like bloody hoofs, and its muscles weren't as pronounced. I think I read in an interview with John Romero that the Shambler was supposed to have fur or something.
